messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] warning, re Blazing Saddles
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the warning, Sandra. Accalia usually doesn t want to watch any of our movies with us yet. She ll run upstairs and watch her own thing unless we
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the warning, Sandra. Accalia usually doesn't want to watch any of
"our" movies with us yet. She'll run upstairs and watch her own thing unless
we happen to be watching Spiderman or Hulk :)

Amy
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99) and Cole (9/03/02)
"Allow children to be happy in their own way, for what better
way will they find?"
--Dr, Samuel Johnson
http://thissideofsomewhere.blogspot.com/


> Watch it alone before you share it with your kids.
>
> I liked it when I was younger, but the one time I rented it after I had kids,
> I took it back without sharing it with them because of much use of "the 'n'
> word," which at the time they had never heard, and which even now they've
> heard
> very rarely, and I'm interested in keeping it that way. Someday they'll see
> it.

messages.subject: warning, re Blazing Saddles
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/17/03 7:10:18 AM, acnelson@iw.net writes:  Watch it alone before you
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/17/03 7:10:18 AM, acnelson@... writes:

<< ROFL! I've never seen "Blazing Saddles." Now I'll have to :) >>

Watch it alone before you share it with your kids.

I liked it when I was younger, but the one time I rented it after I had kids,
I took it back without sharing it with them because of much use of "the 'n'
word," which at the time they had never heard, and which even now they've heard
very rarely, and I'm interested in keeping it that way. Someday they'll see
it.

It's worth a warning.
Being born in the 50's and having Texas redneck relatives, I heard it
countless times as a young child, but moving to Northern New Mexico, that use and
reference stopped cold, and there ARE still some pockets of the world where
political correctness in terms of terms <g> has a semblance of maintenance.

Sandra
